entities.name: Lauren Tucker
entities.description: Executive Director of Kiss the Ground; grew up in West Virginia; graduated from American University; studied abroad and volunteered in Africa; wrote thesis on US food aid; helped develop Greenlight New Orleans; mother, thought leader, certified in permaculture design, trained therapist for autistic children.

entities.name: Kiss the Ground
entities.description: Nonprofit organization focused on inspiring participation in the regeneration of the planet, starting with soil. Offers education programs, digital media, documentary, farmer training, scholarship fund, and business education.

entities.name: Ryland Englehart
entities.description: Owner manager of Cafe Gratitude; hosted the founding meeting of Kiss the Ground in his living room.

entities.name: Cafe Gratitude
entities.description: Organic vegan restaurant chain in California; family business of Ryland Englehart.

entities.name: American University
entities.description: University where Lauren Tucker graduated with a degree in psychology and international studies.

entities.name: Greenlight New Orleans
entities.description: Nonprofit developed by Lauren Tucker in response to Hurricane Katrina.

entities.name: West Virginia
entities.description: State where Lauren Tucker grew up, surrounded by natural beauty and conventional corn and soy fields.

entities.name: Africa
entities.description: Continent where Lauren Tucker studied abroad and volunteered.

entities.name: Ethiopia
entities.description: Country included in Lauren Tucker's thesis on US food aid.

entities.name: North Korea
entities.description: Country included in Lauren Tucker's thesis on US food aid.

entities.name: Malawi
entities.description: Country included in Lauren Tucker's thesis on US food aid.

entities.name: Katrina
entities.description: Hurricane that devastated New Orleans, leading to the creation of Greenlight New Orleans.

entities.name: farmer training program
entities.description: A program for training farmers, mentioned as part of a suite of initiatives.

entities.name: scholarship fund for farmers
entities.description: A scholarship fund aimed at supporting farmers.

entities.name: business education program
entities.description: A program providing business education, mentioned alongside other initiatives.

entities.name: regeneration of our planet
entities.description: The idea of making it easier for people to participate in planetary regeneration.

entities.name: agriculture
entities.description: Mentioned as both a significant emitter of greenhouse gases and as a field for regenerative practices.

entities.name: regenerative agriculture
entities.description: Agriculture that helps sequester carbon and stabilize climate.

entities.name: carbon
entities.description: A chemical element central to climate discussions, present in soils, plants, animals, and the atmosphere.

entities.name: carbon dioxide
entities.description: A greenhouse gas emitted by agriculture and other sources, and absorbed by plants.

entities.name: modern agriculture
entities.description: Agricultural practices that include tilling and use of synthetic fertilizers, contributing to carbon emissions.

entities.name: synthetic fertilizer
entities.description: Fertilizer produced from synthetic oil, used in modern agriculture and contributing to carbon emissions.

entities.name: soil
entities.description: The upper layer of earth in which plants grow, important for carbon storage and soil health.

entities.name: microbes and fungi
entities.description: Microorganisms in healthy soil that help store carbon and support plant growth.

entities.name: not tilling
entities.description: A farming practice that avoids disturbing the soil, helping to retain carbon and improve soil health.

entities.name: keeping the soil covered with living plant material
entities.description: A farming method to maintain soil health and carbon storage.

entities.name: integrating animals and trees
entities.description: A regenerative agriculture practice to improve soil health and ecosystem diversity.

entities.name: soil life
entities.description: Microorganisms and biological activity in soil that contribute to soil health and carbon storage.

entities.name: living plant material
entities.description: Plants that cover the soil, contributing to soil health.

entities.name: integrating animals and trees and annual crops
entities.description: Farming practice of combining animals, trees, and crops to improve soil health.

entities.name: pesticides
entities.description: Chemicals used in farming that can kill soil life.

entities.name: carbon farming movement
entities.description: A growing movement focused on farming practices that prioritize carbon storage in soil.

entities.name: gardening
entities.description: Growing plants in homes, yards, and neighborhoods.

entities.name: food choices
entities.description: Decisions made by consumers that can support soil stewardship and ecosystem regeneration.

entities.name: soil stewardship
entities.description: Practices that maintain and regenerate healthy soils.

entities.name: regeneration of ecosystems
entities.description: Restoring and improving the health of ecosystems through agricultural practices.

entities.name: purchasing guide
entities.description: Guide being developed to help consumers make food choices that support healthy soils.

entities.name: Wendell Berry
entities.description: Person quoted as saying 'eating is an agricultural act.'

entities.name: farmer's market
entities.description: Local market where farmers sell their produce directly to consumers.

entities.name: Mark Gutridge
entities.description: A good friend who has oil in farms and is an amazing soil steward.

entities.name: oil in farms
entities.description: Farms associated with Mark Gutridge, known for soil stewardship.

entities.name: corporation in the area
entities.description: A company that held an event at Mark Gutridge's farm for employees and staff.

entities.name: Why on Earth
entities.description: A book that discusses growing, knowing, and showing food.

entities.name: third party certifications
entities.description: Labels and certifications that verify practices in supply and value chains.

entities.name: supply chains
entities.description: Systems for moving food and products from farms to consumers.

entities.name: value chains
entities.description: Systems that add value to products as they move from farm to consumer.

entities.name: Ryland's father
entities.description: One of the founders of Kepaic Gratitude and a farmer in northern California.

entities.name: Kepaic Gratitude
entities.description: Organization founded by Ryland's father, associated with farming in northern California.

entities.name: Why on Earth Community Stewardship and Sustainability Podcast Series
entities.description: Podcast series focused on stewardship and sustainability, featuring Lauren Tucker as a guest.

entities.name: kisstheground.com
entities.description: Website for Kiss the Ground, providing purchasing guide and free curriculum.

entities.name: Kiss the Ground Instagram
entities.description: Social media account for Kiss the Ground on Instagram.

entities.name: the ground CA
entities.description: Social media handle for Kiss the Ground on Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube.

entities.name: Why on Earth.org slash market
entities.description: Marketplace website for Why on Earth, offering eBooks and audiobooks.

entities.name: Santa Barbara
entities.description: Region included in the LA food shed, known for local foods like dry-formed prickly pear.

entities.name: LA
entities.description: City whose food shed includes Santa Barbara.

entities.name: dry-formed prickly pear
entities.description: A tequila-like product made from prickly pear grown in Santa Barbara.

entities.name: CSA shares
entities.description: Community-supported agriculture shares purchased by companies from local farmers.

entities.name: The Soil Story
entities.description: A four-minute educational video created by Kiss the Ground explaining the carbon cycle and the role of plants and soil in carbon movement.

entities.name: Lifelab
entities.description: Gardening education nonprofit based in Santa Cruz, California; partnered with Kiss the Ground to develop curriculum for middle school students.

entities.name: Santa Cruz, California
entities.description: Location of Lifelab, the gardening education nonprofit.

entities.name: carbon cycle
entities.description: Scientific concept explained in The Soil Story video and curriculum, describing how carbon moves through the environment.

entities.name: soil microbiology
entities.description: Topic covered in the curriculum, teaching about the living components and composition of soil.

entities.name: photosynthesis
entities.description: Scientific process taught in the curriculum, typically learned by middle school students.

entities.name: Lauren
entities.description: Participant in a conversation about soil, spirituality, and environmental practices.

entities.name: Venice
entities.description: Location where a soil-related ceremony was held with Lauren and her team.

entities.name: soil carbon sequestration
entities.description: Environmental practice discussed as an opportunity to mitigate climate change by storing carbon in soil.

entities.name: major food brands
entities.description: Organizations looking to innovate their supply chains for environmental impact.

entities.name: plants
entities.description: Living organisms discussed as part of the planet's ecosystem, dependent on humans and vice versa.

entities.name: animals
entities.description: Living organisms discussed as part of the planet's ecosystem, dependent on humans and vice versa.

entities.name: humans
entities.description: Species discussed in relation to soil, environment, and spiritual connection to the planet.

entities.name: indigenous traditions
entities.description: Worldwide traditions referenced as having deep ecological connections.

entities.name: Venice, California
entities.description: A neighborhood in Los Angeles, formerly its own city, now the site of a community garden project on city-owned property.

entities.name: City of LA
entities.description: The city government of Los Angeles, owner of the property where the community garden is located.

entities.name: Poetry nonprofit
entities.description: Nonprofit organization focused on poetry, leasing one of the historic buildings in Venice for arts purposes.

entities.name: Mural painting nonprofit
entities.description: Nonprofit organization focused on public art and mural painting, leasing one of the historic buildings in Venice.

entities.name: community partner
entities.description: A local organization that will take over and steward the community garden project, focusing on working and training homeless youth.

entities.name: homeless youth
entities.description: Young people experiencing homelessness who will be trained and supported by the community partner through the garden project.

entities.name: community garden project
entities.description: A community-driven project transforming city-owned lawns into productive gardens, involving volunteers and benefiting local residents and homeless youth.

entities.name: serotonin production
entities.description: A neurochemical process that is increased by physical contact with soil, contributing to reduced stress and improved well-being.

entities.name: volunteers
entities.description: Over 700 individuals who volunteered to help transform and maintain the community garden in Venice.

entities.name: Aaron
entities.description: Interviewer who thanked Lauren and participated in the conversation.

entities.name: community project
entities.description: A local initiative that brought people together to volunteer and improve a space, referenced as thriving due to community involvement.

entities.name: national and international coalitions
entities.description: Organizations that Lauren's group became part of, focused on forwarding regenerative agriculture.

entities.name: brands
entities.description: Commercial entities inspired by Lauren's group's work in regenerative agriculture.

entities.name: farmers
entities.description: Individuals inspired by Lauren's group's work in regenerative agriculture.

entities.name: consumers
entities.description: People inspired by Lauren's group's work in regenerative agriculture.
